str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
As if, as it were, like; with numbers: about. From hos and ei; as if.
Five thousand. From pentakis and chilioi; five times a thousand.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From kata and klino; to recline down, i.e. to take a place at table.
A primary preposition and adverb; properly, up; but used severally, or at.
From a derivative of klino; properly, reclination, i.e., a party at a meal.
As if, as it were, like; with numbers: about. From hos and ei; as if.
